Swoggle¶

This defines the game of swoggle - a silly game played on a chessboard that we came up with over the holidays.

In this notebook, we deinfe the game, specify valid moves and check that the basic functionality works.

Cells¶

The board is an 8x8 grid of cells. We'll use a 'Cell' class to represent them, with the following attributes:

cell = {'x', 'y', 'drone':bool, 'player':PID, 'base':PID}

class Cell[source]

Cell(x, y, drone=False, player=None, base=None)

Represent a cell on the game board

We'll use these cells to represent squares on the board

The board representation¶

A matrix of cells (the board), as well as the jail aka 'Swoggle Spa' (for captured players).

Also need a way to do moves. Done with move(player, start, end, dice roll, drone, powerjump) where drone and powerjump are special moves.

class Board[source]

Board(verbose=True)

Trial game¶

This was used to test the basic moves. But we'll actually run games with the Swoggle class that wraps board with some useful functions.

# Create a board
b = Board()

# Add some bases and draw starting setup
b.board[0][0].player = 1
b.board[0][0].base = 1 
b.board[7][7].player = 2
b.board[7][7].base = 2
b.board[3][3].drone = True
b.show()

print('next')

b.move(1, (0, 0), (1, 1), 1)
b.show()
b.move(1, (1, 1), (6, 6), 4)
b.show()
b.move(1, (1, 1), (4, 4), 5, drone=True) # Fails  - no drone
b.show()
b.move(1, (1, 1), (3, 3), 5, drone=False) # Start from drone loc
b.move(1, (3, 3), (4, 4), 5, drone=True) # Works
b.show()

The Swoggle Class¶

This class wraps a board, adds default setup, includes dice and the concept of agents. The agents themselves will be included in the 01_AI

class Swoggle[source]

Swoggle(agents=[], setup='basic', verbose=True)

The game itself

# Show basic setup
s = Swoggle(agents=[])
s.show()

[1.1][...][...][...][...][...][...][4.4]

# Making a move:
s.move(1, (0, 0), (3, 2), 5)
s.show()

notebook2script()
